message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,750,000. It's a fair price considering its value to you. I believe this is a win-win situation. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,500,000. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to me.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1,500,000 is simply too low for me.  I'm willing to come down a bit from my initial offer. I'm proposing $1,650,000. This is a fair compromise, and I believe it's still a good deal for you. Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm thinking more along the lines of $1,550,000. This is the highest price I'm willing to pay for the product.
Bob, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering $1,600,000 for the product.  This is a good price for both of us.  If we can't reach an agreement, I may have to explore other options.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still trying to get the best deal possible. I'm thinking more along the lines of $1,575,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to pay for the product.
Bob, I'm willing to come down to $1,590,000. This is a fair price for both of us, and it's a good deal for you considering the value of the product. Let's finalize this deal.

I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm thinking more along the lines of $1,570,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to pay for the product.
